Elon Musk’s chatbot, Grok, comes under fire for nude deepfakes

FROM DRUG use to libel suits, Elon Musk has long been able to shrug off problems that would have imperilled most bosses. But the reaction to a recent update to Grok, the AI chatbot linked to X, the billionaire’s social network, poses a…

external.description: FROM DRUG use to libel suits, Elon Musk has long been able to shrug off problems that would have imperilled most bosses. But the reaction to a recent update to Grok, the AI chatbot linked to X, the billionaire’s social network, poses a fresh test of his imperviousness. Grok’s willingness to churn out nude deepfakes has led to scrutiny in Britain and Australia, among other places, and outright bans of the chatbot in Malaysia and Indonesia.
external.title: Elon Musk’s chatbot, Grok, comes under fire for nude deepfakes

record.text: Je peux pas m’empêcher de me rappeler la fin du collège et le lycée, les mecs avaient des “facilités” dès lors qu’ils avaient des notes correctes en maths et physique, les filles qui avaient pareil ou plus, c’était qu’elles avaient bien travaillé.

value.text: “Plus la matière est, dans les représentations, fortement associée aux garçons – on a utilisé le terme de «prédominance masculine» dans l’étude –, à savoir les sciences dures comme les mathématiques ou la physique, plus on observe une différence genrée dans les commentaires des professeurs”
Que révèle l'étude de 600.000 bulletins de terminale scientifique ? A niveau scolaire égal, le vocabulaire utilisé pour qualifier le travail des élèves diffère selon le genre.

external.description: Une étude de l’Institut des politiques publiques révèle le poids des stéréotypes de genre dans les bulletins scolaires sans pouvoir évaluer les conséquences dans la poursuite d’études des jeunes filles.
external.title: «Dans les matières scientifiques, les enseignants ont tendance à qualifier positivement les compétences des garçons et plutôt négativement celles des filles»

record.text: When the AP writes that “Grok” is “under fire”, it is a clear demonstration that the current use of anthropomorphic language for gen AI software facilitates the elimination of accountability for the people who create and distribute it.

Sinon, on a la preuve qu’on peut prêter des pensées racistes aux policiers sans être accusé de les diffamer par le ministre de l’Intérieur. 

L’astuce c’est qu’il faut partager les pensées racistes.

Hoskinson: "You've collapsed crypto from a public perception, to crypto equals Trump equals bad .... Crypto equals corruption. It's a wealth transfer mechanism for Trump and his friends."

www.coindesk.com/policy/2026/...

images.alt: “If you launch something and it's mostly an extractive venture, then what you've effectively done is you've collapsed crypto from a public perception, to crypto equals Trump equals bad, you know, amongst the left,” he said. “You can't alienate half the country and then expect them to show up.”

He said that his invitations to White House events were extended and withdrawn without explanation during the early days of the administration. Additionally, when ADA, Cardano’s token, was named part of the administration’s crypto reserve, he stated that he and his team weren't contacted at all. "When the president said ADA is in the reserve, XRP is in the reserve, and Solana is in the reserve, and I was just like, okay, well sh*t, I'm just gonna get subpoenaed now when the Democrats get back in power, and they're going to think I had something to do with it. We had nothing to do with it. We never discussed it with them."

“There's no accountability. There's no respect for the rule of law, and there's no respect for the balance of power,” he said.

The lack of leadership, Hoskinson argued, has left the crypto industry politically weaponized and without a path forward. “Crypto equals corruption. It's a wealth transfer mechanism for Trump and his friends. And that didn’t help any of us.”

“If you launch something and it's mostly an extractive venture, then what you've effectively done is you've collapsed crypto from a public perception, to crypto equals Trump equals bad, you know, amongst the left,” he said. “You can't alienate half the country and then expect them to show up.”

He said that his invitations to White House events were extended and withdrawn without explanation during the early days of the administration. Additionally, when ADA, Cardano’s token, was named part of the administration’s crypto reserve, he stated that he and his team weren't contacted at all. "When the president said ADA is in the reserve, XRP is in the reserve, and Solana is in the reserve, and I was just like, okay, well sh*t, I'm just gonna get subpoenaed now when the Democrats get back in power, and they're going to think I had something to do with it. We had nothing to do with it. We never discussed it with them."

“There's no accountability. There's no respect for the rule of law, and there's no respect for the balance of power,” he said.

The lack of leadership, Hoskinson argued, has left the crypto industry politically weaponized and without a path forward. “Crypto equals corruption. It's a wealth transfer mechanism for Trump and his friends. And that didn’t help any of us.”

record.text:
Salesforce rolls out new Slackbot AI agent as it battles Microsoft and Google in workplace AI

Salesforce has launched a significantly revamped Slackbot, transforming it into an AI-powered agent capable of complex tasks like data searching and docum…

Telegram AI Digest
#copilot #geminiai #microsoft

external.description: Salesforce has launched a significantly revamped Slackbot, transforming it into an AI-powered agent capable of complex tasks like data searching and document drafting. The new Slackbot is designed to be the central point for an "agentic AI" environment, positioning Slack at the forefront of this emerging technology. Built on a large language model from Anthropic's Claude, the new Slackbot offers improved functionalities compared to its predecessor. Salesforce plans to integrate additional AI providers like Google's Gemini and potentially OpenAI in the future. Internal testing with 80,000 employees showed high adoption rates and significantly improved productivity. Slackbot can synthesize information from multiple sources, generate insights, and even compile them into shareable documents. Early adopters like Beast Industries report substantial time savings for employees. Salesforce is directly competing with Microsoft's Copilot and Google's Gemini, emphasizing Slackbot's contextual awareness and convenience. Salesforce aims for Slackbot to become a "super agent" coordinating other AI agents. While Slackbot is included in existing plans, increased API access costs from Salesforce could affect third-party applications.
external.title: Salesforce rolls out new Slackbot AI agent as it battles Microsoft and Google in workplace AI

record.text: AI writing uses odd sentence and paragraph breaks. Especially with big ideas. Because it doesn’t know where sentences should stop. But its training data tells it that impactful writing uses short sentences and paragraphs. See my ironic prompt and the output. #AIslop #saveourbrains

images.alt: A screenshot of a Copilot prompt that reads "Write a long-form Facebook post defending my writing as not being written by AI. Include points about declining literacy, the fact that people don't want to read long posts, how people are being penalised for being good writers and some stats about how AI detectors are unreliable. The post should be around 1500 words long.""

A screenshot of part of a Copilot response that reads "But the fact that many people don’t want to read long posts doesn’t mean that long posts are AI-generated—it just means long posts are becoming rare.
And as anything becomes rare, people start to doubt its authenticity.
This is the new digital paradox:
People assume writing must be AI because they don’t see humans writing anymore."

A screenshot of a Copilot prompt that reads "Write a long-form Facebook post defending my writing as not being written by AI. Include points about declining literacy, the fact that people don't want to read long posts, how people are being penalised for being good writers and some stats about how AI detectors are unreliable. The post should be around 1500 words long.""

A screenshot of part of a Copilot response that reads "But the fact that many people don’t want to read long posts doesn’t mean that long posts are AI-generated—it just means long posts are becoming rare.
And as anything becomes rare, people start to doubt its authenticity.
This is the new digital paradox:
People assume writing must be AI because they don’t see humans writing anymore."

record.text: I first read that as 'the corruption of STEAKHOUSES', and now I really want to know about the dirty dealings going on behind the scenes at Ruth's Chris.

As I grow increasingly frustrated with the proliferation of long form genAI posts on Facebook, I take solace in the knowledge that these people are creating their own redundancy. There is no long term money in something the reader can create themselves with zero time or skill. #aislop

So let's review:

❌ AI harms authors because it violates copyright.

✅ AI harms authors because it violates their rights to attribution and integrity.

The right to attribution.  Don't repost people's work without attribution.

The right to use a pen name or to publish anonymously.  Publishers should protect the privacy of authors.

The right to integrity.  Editors should not cut up your work to make it say something you do not endorse.

Many people are aware that copyright originated as and remains a protection for publishers, not authors.  

However, there are longstanding rights intended to protect authors.  These are legally called 'the moral rights of authors.'

These rights include:

A funny thing happened when I stopped over-rotating on "I'm not a developer" and just started using the tools to ask questions about something I wanted to accomplish: I started accomplishing those things. Code was a byproduct, but what I was actually doing was getting shit done.

THAT'S kinda cool.

I love this take, especially "But for building scripts to analyze that data? Perfect." I've always been a fan of "bounded" AI, as opposed to "it's magic pixie dust, sprinkle on everything" AI, and in some places it's incredibly useful.

Never has there been a better, more practical example of how far a person can fall. Imagine being famous one minute and then being so reviled that your death is a giant...meh. 

That's Scott Adams. Don't be like Scott Adams.

古いヨーロッパの服飾などもかなりヤバいと聞いた。もう画像検索してもまともな結果にたどり着けないとか。まぁ、ざっと見る限りはAIだけの罪ではないが…

職業上の立場から生成AIには反対なんだけど、そういうのは置いといても、野生動物の画像で生成動画を作るのを法律で禁止してくれないかな

これ以上ない情報汚染だし、間違った知識が伝わるし、正しい動物や生物の資料があったとしてもそれが本物だという確信が取れなくなってしまうので、本当に良くない

そういう人の中に「これはAIではありません」みたいな注釈をつけてAI動画を貼るすげーやつもいて
そういう人間は控えめに言って地獄に落ちて欲しい

What's your most recent AI development hack or productivity booster?

- Directly in Visual Studio... But surely it has enough context?

何かを覚えた直後にやる

話がまとまらない時用

頭が固まってる時用

10. 完璧な謝罪文の生成
やらかした時用
▶「（経緯）で相手に迷惑をかけました。言い訳をせず、誠意が伝わる謝罪文を作成して。相手は（関係性）」

(Whoops; in the context of MCP, "server" and "client" get mixed up from the way I use them here. Here, I'm talking about the "client" being like, ChatGPT, and the "server" being the model instance being hosted on OpenAI's servers, and both speaking Chat Completions.)

Cuz remember that when your client sends an inference request, the server just Accepts it. The server (typically) has no way to track an ongoing session; each request is tabula rasa from its perspective. Not to sound like ChatGPT but the client is not just authoritative, it's authorial.
Pretty much yeah. There's no distinction in the Chat Completions standard that says a chat marked as Assistant *actually* needs to come from the model. This is leveraged in RP scene all the time

it's really, really bad
